lines.content: BossMan is the individual project component for CS2113, AY23/24 Semester 2.
BossMan is CLI task management assistant that allows users to track tasks like todos, deadlines and events.
To start `BossMan` Using the `jar` file, go to the containing folder for BossMan. Then, on your terminal of choice, run:
BossMan comes with features for you to manage your daily tasks using CLI.
Manage your work by creating tasks
BossMan provides three types of tasks for creation:
BossMan can help you `mark`, `unmark`, `list`, `delete` and `find` your tasks.
- mark allows you to tick off your todos, deadline and events so you can keep track of what tasks are done.
- unmark allows you to untick your tasks if you made an error or if the task is still not done.
- list can list all your tasks to get an overview of what you've done so far.
- delete can delete task specified in the user input
- find can filter the tasks you are looking for by using a keyword.
BossMan automatically saves all your task data to a text file. When you start BossMan up again, it will load up your tasks from previous sessions automatically.
Create a todo type of task for BossMan to track.
BossMan will read your todo description, and echo it back to you via console after adding it to your task list.
Now you have 10 tasks in the list.
Create a deadline type of task for BossMan to track.
Deadlines have a due date, a compulsory parameter that must be included.
The date format must be formatted as shown below.
BossMan will read your deadline and due date, and echo it back to you via console after adding it to your task list.
Now you have 11 tasks in the list.
Create an event type of task for BossMan to track.
Events have a from and to time/ date. These are compulsory parameters.
Unlike deadline, there is no restriction for the format for from and to parameters.
BossMan will read your event, from and to dates, and will echo it back to you via console after adding it to your task list.
Now you have 12 tasks in the list.
The list contains an overview of each tasks' status.
Returns your task list, with tasks sorted in chronological order when it was added.
Marks a task in the tasklist as done.
The task number is the number of the task from running list.
If the task is already done, BossMan will still go ahead and mark it done again.
BossMan tags the task as done and echos it back to you.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Marks a task in the tasklist as NOT done.
The task number is the number of the task from running list.
If the task is already not done, BossMan will still go ahead and mark it as undone again.
BossMan tags the task as not done and echos it back to you.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Removes a task from your task list.
The task number is the number of the task from running list.
BossMan removes the task matching the task number from your tasklist. After that, BossMan echoes the removed task back to you.
Ask BossMan to find all tasks that contain search query keyword.
BossMan filters out all tasks whose descriptions contains query keyword.
Exits BossMan application, returning you to your shell.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!

* BossMan is a CLI task management assistant. It is built as part of AY2324 S2 CS2113 iP.
* BossMan allows users to track and manage their tasks, and has persistent data storage.
* BossMan can track todos, deadlines, events.

* BossManExceptions is the base class for exceptions specific to the BossMan application.
* It extends the Exception class to handle custom exceptions.
* Constructs a BossManExceptions with the specified detail message.
* @param message the detail message (which is saved for later retrieval by the getMessage() method)
* InvalidDeadlineCommandException is thrown when there is an error related to a deadline command.
* It is a subclass of BossManExceptions.
* Constructs an InvalidDeadlineCommandException with the specified detail message.
* Prepends "Deadline error: " to the message for clarity.
* @param message the detail message (which is saved for later retrieval by the getMessage() method)
* InvalidDeleteCommandException is thrown when there is an error related to a delete command.
* It is a subclass of BossManExceptions.
* Constructs an InvalidDeleteCommandException with the specified detail message.
* Prepends "Delete error: " to the message for clarity.
* @param message the detail message (which is saved for later retrieval by the getMessage() method)
* InvalidEventCommandException is thrown when there is an error related to an event command.
* It is a subclass of BossManExceptions.
* Constructs an InvalidEventCommandException with the specified detail message.
* Prepends "Event error: " to the message for clarity.
* @param message the detail message (which is saved for later retrieval by the getMessage() method)
* InvalidFindCommandException is thrown when there is an error related to a find command.
* It is a subclass of BossManExceptions.
* Constructs an InvalidFindCommandException with the specified detail message.
* Prepends "Find error: " to the message for clarity.
* @param message the detail message (which is saved for later retrieval by the getMessage() method)
* InvalidMarkCommandException is thrown when there is an error related to a mark or unmark command.
* It is a subclass of BossManExceptions.
* Constructs an InvalidMarkCommandException with the specified detail message.
* Prepends "Mark/ unmark error: " to the message for clarity.
* @param message the detail message (which is saved for later retrieval by the getMessage() method)
* InvalidTodoCommandException is thrown when there is an error related to a todo command.
* It is a subclass of BossManExceptions.
* Constructs an InvalidTodoCommandException with the specified detail message.
* Prepends "Todo error: " to the message for clarity.
* @param message the detail message (which is saved for later retrieval by the getMessage() method)
* UnknownCommandException is thrown when the user input does not correspond to any known command.
* It is a subclass of BossManExceptions.
* Constructs an UnknownCommandException with the specified detail message.
* Prepends "Error: " to the message for clarity.
* @param message the detail message (which is saved for later retrieval by the getMessage() method)
* Parser class is responsible for parsing user input and determining the corresponding command.

* @throws BossManExceptions if an error occurs while determining the command
